document.docAuthor: Németh, Tamás, Brůha, Petr & Kundrata, Robin
document.masterDocTitle: Discovery of a new species of Lacon Laporte (Coleoptera: Elateridae: Agrypninae) endemic to Cyprus, with a modified tarsal morphology

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Discovery of a new species of Lacon Laporte (Coleoptera: Elateridae: Agrypninae) endemic to Cyprus, with a modified tarsal morphology

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3 . Habitus images and body parts of
Lacon punctatus
from Cyprus. A–B. Dorsal view of male and female, respectively. C–D. Pronotum of male and female, respectively. E–F. Basal and medial antennomeres of male and female, respectively. G. Fore tarsomeres of male. H. Hind tarsomeres of male. Scale bars = 0.5 mm (Figs G–H), 1 mm (Figs E–F), 2 mm (Figs C–D), 3 mm (Figs A–B).

FIGURE 4 . Abdominal terminal segments and genitalia of
Lacon punctatus
from Cyprus. A–F. Male. A. Aedeagus, dorsal view. B. Aedeagus, ventral view. C. Abdominal tergites IX–X. D. Abdominal sternites IX–X. E. Abdominal tergite VIII. F. Abdominal sternite VIII. G–J Female. G. Abdominal tergite VIII. H. Abdominal sternite VIII. I. Ovipositor. J. Bursa copulatrix with inner sclerites. Scale bars = 0.5 mm (Figs A–I), 1 mm (Fig. J).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Additional examined material of
L. punctatus
from the Levant , Asia Minor, northern Africa and Europe is deposited in the collections of HNHM, NHMW, PCPB, PCRK, PCJM, Museum National d’Histoire Naturelle , Paris , France ( MNHN )
,
Senckenberg Deutsches Entomologisches Institut , Müncheberg , Germany ( SDEI )
,
and Steinhardt Museum of Natural History , Tel Aviv University , Tel Aviv , Israel ( SMNH-TAU )
.
